ETYMOLOGY: From re- 'again' + birth (from Old Norse byrðr 'birth, burden', related to Old English beran 'to carry, bring forth').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The process of being born again, or of coming back into existence or prominence after a period of decline or death.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The city experienced a rebirth after years of economic stagnation.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这座城市在多年的经济停滞后经历了复兴。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A spiritual or mystical process of being born again, often involving a fundamental change in one's life or beliefs.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many religions speak of spiritual rebirth as a path to salvation.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多宗教都将精神上的再生视为通向救赎的道路。
